name: Wakie
headline: A social app for phone calls. Express yourself and make real friends.
description: Users perform millions of calls and send hundreds of millions of messages every month. The topics vary from language practicing to mental issues to personal life conversations.

founders.name: Grachik Adzhamian, Founder
founders.description: Built four successful companies, currently working on the biggest thing in my life

raw_markdown='[![](http://www.wakie.com/images/tild3530-6161-4461-a530-383537373338__image.png)](http://www.wakie.com/<https:/wakie.com/>)
[En](http://www.wakie.com/<https:/wakie.com/>)
[Ar](http://www.wakie.com/<https:/wakie.com/ar>)
![](http://www.wakie.com/images/tild6337-3363-4430-a133-366561663865__logo_220.png)

  * [What you get](http://www.wakie.com/<#rec83878706>)
  * [Our members love us](http://www.wakie.com/<#rec83878707>)
  * [Media loves us](http://www.wakie.com/<#rec83878708>)
  * [Wakie Manifesto](http://www.wakie.com/<#rec83878709>)


[English](http://www.wakie.com/<https:/wakie.com>)[Arabic](http://www.wakie.com/<https:/wakie.com/ar>)
# 
Talk to strangers 
Connect with the right person for any question, moment or life situation. Wakie is a mobile app for phone calls. A community where you say what you want to talk about and get to have a phone call with interested person right away.
[](http://www.wakie.com/<https:/itunes.apple.com/us/app/wakie-talk-to-people-easily/id879488038?mt=8>)
[](http://www.wakie.com/<https:/play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.wakie.android>)
![Wakie is an app to talk to strangers on the phone](http://www.wakie.com/images/tild3165-3265-4934-b561-646434383539__iphone.png)
## 
Talk to strangers 
Connect with the right person for any question, moment or life situation. 
[](http://www.wakie.com/<https:/itunes.apple.com/us/app/wakie-talk-to-people-easily/id879488038?mt=8>)
[](http://www.wakie.com/<https:/play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.wakie.android>)
![Wakie is an app to talk to strangers on the phone](http://www.wakie.com/images/tild6233-6630-4266-b036-356531313066__iphone.png)
How it works
Find the right person to talk to instantly
1
Set a topic
Say, 'I want to practice Spanish with a native speaker' or 'I want to sing a song and get honest feedback'. Books, news, cooking, parenting, business, love, and any other life issue you can think of — on Wakie, you can find someone to talk about it within seconds.
2
Get on a phone call
Have a voice chat with a stranger. Pour your heart out and don't be afraid to express your true emotions. Wakie is a pseudonymous community and no one will judge you like on most other social media services.
3
Find a true friend
When you open up and express your true self, you can click with someone who feels exactly the same way and that is the fantastic basis from which to start a great friendship. 55% of long term Wakie members say they found one or several real friends here.
Watch how calling works
What you get
  * A safe space where you can be your true self
No judgement and no limits to share your emotions. Wakie is a pseudonymous community where we are free to set any nickname and express our true emotions. Sometimes good, sometimes not so good.
  * Wakie converts strangers into friends 
True friendship is a rare thing nowadays. Being extremely open is rewarding because other people can relate to what you say and provide sincere support.
  * Fill your life with joy and excitement 
Wakie is your free world to get rid of boredom and have fun!


Our members love us
  * Niya
Wakie is a platform where I found some true gems of my life and have them in my real life. It's a place where you could express what you really are and understand others also.
  * Sandman/Dream 
Sometimes, it's easier to talk about certain things that bother you, with strangers than your closest friends. And wakie has some of the kindest strangers you'll ever meet. 
  * Maris Perish
I love this app because I can reach out and help others that are hurting like me. That heals me.


Media loves us
  * BBC
It could soon be bedtime for the snooze button.
  * TechCrunch
A fun idea which may just go viral.
  * The Guardian 
Wakie is quite fun. The community seems friendly.


## How To Talk To Strangers And Turn them Into Friends?
And is it safe to talk to strangers?
In [**this article**](http://www.wakie.com/<https:/wakie.com/talk-to-strangers>) we share our thoughts on talking to strangers in general and on Wakie app.Why should we talk to strangers? Because it makes us happier.A recent [study](http://www.wakie.com/<https:/news.uchicago.edu/story/couples-sometimes-communicate-no-better-strangers-study-finds>) at the University of Chicago found that sometimes we communicate better with strangers than friends and spouses. So please find ways to talk to strangers safely and be happy! **[Read more](http://www.wakie.com/<https:/wakie.com/talk-to-strangers>)**
Wakie Manifesto
**In this doc we say what we are for and what we are against.** Wakie is a global community of strangers who convert into friends through a meaningful conversation. We call our members Wakies, who represent a contre-culture of social media. Unlike social media users, we represent our true selves, not an imaginary person our 'friends' or followers want to see and like. When we like something, we tell it openly. Same if we dislike something. What we are for and what we are not? **+** **For a deep conversation** **-** **Against Discrimination** **-** **Against Bullying****+** **For Fun**
[](http://www.wakie.com/<https:/docs.google.com/document/d/1_Gkpddz_r33nqZ2J7aEbKl8aXd7l4h03cdQA_Tr1bfs/edit?usp=sharing>)Read the full Manifesto  
---  
"The best way to cheer yourself up is to cheer someone else up" - Mark Twain
[](http://www.wakie.com/<https:/itunes.apple.com/us/app/wakie-talk-to-people-easily/id879488038?mt=8>)Get Wakie for iPhone  
---  
[](http://www.wakie.com/<https:/play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.wakie.android>)Get Wakie for Android  
---  
Stay in touchfeedback@wakie.com
  * [](http://www.wakie.com/<https:/FACEBOOK.COM/WAKIEAPP>)
  * [](http://www.wakie.com/<https:/TWITTER.COM/WAKIEAPP>)


Wakie is founded by 2 brothers: [Hrachik Adjamian](http://www.wakie.com/<https:/www.linkedin.com/in/hrachik/>) and [Tat Ajamyan](http://www.wakie.com/<https:/www.linkedin.com/in/tatajamian/>) (who is also the co-founder of [SleepDoctor](http://www.wakie.com/<https:/sleepdoctor.fr/>)).
  * [Terms of Service](http://www.wakie.com/<https:/wakie.com/docs/terms_en>)
  * [Community Guidelines](http://www.wakie.com/<https:/wakie.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/articles/360037206993-Wakie-Community-Guidelines>)
  * [FAQ](http://www.wakie.com/<https:/wakie.com/docs/faq_en>)
  * [Blog](http://www.wakie.com/<https:/wakie.com/blog>)
  * [How To Talk To Strangers?](http://www.wakie.com/<https:/wakie.com/talk-to-strangers>)

' fit_markdown='' fit_html=''
generated_description:
Wakie is an innovative social app designed for meaningful phone conversations, aiming to connect users and help them express themselves and cultivate real friendships. Founded in 2014 by brothers Hrachik Adjamian and Tat Ajamyan, Wakie emerged from Y Combinator's Winter 2016 batch and has quickly grown into a dynamic platform with thousands of users engaging in millions of calls every month.

Located in Menlo Park, CA, Wakie operates with a small yet dedicated team of ten. The app thrives on a strong community spirit, allowing users to discuss a variety of topics—from language practice and mental health to everyday life challenges. It’s this diverse range of discussions that enriches the user experience, fostering genuine connections.

The app operates simply yet effectively. Users set a topic—like wanting to practice Spanish or seeking advice on personal issues—and are matched with someone interested in chatting about that subject. What sets Wakie apart from mainstream social media platforms is the emphasis on anonymity and the absence of judgment; it creates a safe space for individuals to open up and explore deeper connections.

Wakie's commitment to promoting mental health and community building is evident in its user testimonials. Many long-term members report forming genuine friendships through the app, highlighting its role as a therapeutic outlet. The media has taken notice too, with mentions in outlets like BBC and TechCrunch talking about its potential to reshape how we communicate.

In terms of ethos, Wakie's manifesto champions deep conversations, fun interactions, and stands firmly against bullying and discrimination. They truly aim to redefine what social media can be—a space where people embrace their authentic selves rather than curating a false persona for likes and shares.

With a straightforward, engaging approach and a growing global community, Wakie is not just another app; it’s a movement towards better communication and genuine friendships in an age often dominated by superficial interactions. Want to join the conversation? You can learn more and download the app at [Wakie's official website](http://www.wakie.com).
